section.title: Introduction
section.p: The documentation (the websites) for both Divvun.no and Giellatekno is served to the public via forrest, and is renewed very often. When you are offline you can read this documentation if you install forrest on your own machine.
section.note: In this document we assume that your username is niillas, that you checkout svn trunk and place forrest into the map /Users/niillas/Documents. /Users/niillas/Documents is also referred to as $HOME/Documents throughout this document.

section.title: Fetching and compiling forrest on unix systems

ul.li: Open a terminal. Write cd Documents and press enter.
Then write svn co http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/forrest/trunk forrest. Answer positively to all questions asked.
Then write cd forrest/main followed by ./build.sh

section.title: Installing the documentation
section.p: Follow the instructions on svn checkout to get our documentation.
section.note: To keep your documentation up to date, you will have to do a svn up regularly in the directory were you have checked out our repository.

section.title: Forrest, jspwiki and UTF-8

section.title: Updating Forrest from svn
section.p: If you would like to update Forrest from svn, then you can issue these commands:
